qaPair.question: What types of batteries do laptop computers use?
qaPair.answer: NiCad or NiMH or Lithium Ion (best and prevalent today)

qaPair.question: What types of RAM do laptop computers use?
qaPair.answer: Dual Data Rate Synchronized Dynamic Random Access Memory

qaPair.question: What types of DDR do laptop computers use?
What is a dual channel DDR?
qaPair.answer: Dual channel DDRs get double speed by pairing up. They must be installed in pairs.

qaPair.question: Tell me about DDR3
qaPair.answer: DDR3 has an 8-bit buffer allowing it to run at twice system clock speed. It has either 240 or 204 pins (so).

qaPair.question: Tell me about DDR4
qaPair.answer: DDR4 can run at eight times system clock speed. It has either 288 or 260 pins (so).

qaPair.question: Tell me about DDR5
qaPair.answer: DDR5 can also run at eight times system clock speed. It has either 288 or 262 pins (s0).

qaPair.question: What types of displays do laptop computers use?
qaPair.answer: IPS or TN or VA or OLED

qaPair.question: What are the strengths and weaknesses of IPS displays?
qaPair.answer: In-Plane Switching displays are inexpensive and have great color but are slow.

qaPair.question: What are the strengths and weaknesses of TN displays?
qaPair.answer: Twisted Nematic displays are fast, but don't show well off axis.

qaPair.question: What are the strengths and weaknesses of VA displays?
qaPair.answer: Vertical Alignment displays are medium speed and color and price.

qaPair.question: What are the strengths and weaknesses of OLED displays?
qaPair.answer: Organic Light-Emitting Diode displays are thin, don't require a backlight, and expensive.
